page.title: 18Ilkeston Fair
page.content: The annual fair is held on the first Thursday following the first Sunday after llth October, and on the succeeding Friday and Saturday. Erewash Borough Council now owns the rights and privileges of it. The fair people are allowed to use the Market Place from 9 a.m. Tuesday. Possession of the other sites is given on Wednesday. The work must be completed by 10 a.m. Thursday when the fair opens. (South Street, Bath Street, East Street and Pimlico). Time for dismantling is midnight Saturday until 12 noon Sunday. Thousands of people visit the fair each year and coach parties also come from neighbouring towns. Fair fever is evident amongst the children of Ilkeston and causes great excitement. Youngsters flock to see the fair being erected. Some work on the stalls.
